image.altText: The man comes from behind in a bear hug

props.synopsis: Crowds gathered at Bondi to lay floral tributes as Sydney Opera House was illuminated by a Hanukkah menorah, 24 hours after 15 people were killed in a "vile", anti-Semitic terror attack.

title.children: Australia mourns Bondi victims

image.altText: A man writes on a white clipboard in a red pen.

props.synopsis: Aspiring Darwin filmmakers with disabilities have been getting job-ready, developing skills in scriptwriting, directing, cinematography and editing. It's the first time the program has been offered in the NT, with plans for it to expand even further.

title.children: Filmmaking program giving storytellers with disabilities a platform

image.altText: an aerial photo of road trains lined up next to a set of cattle yards, with yellow grasslands behind.

props.synopsis: Consolidated Pastoral Company spends more than $300 million to buy the Beetaloo aggregation of stations in the NT.

title.children: Beetaloo Station sold in historic $300m deal to CPC

image.altText: A photo of an Indigenous man looking directly at the camera with Indigenous mural in background.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has won big at this year's Australian Human Rights Awards, winning three out of the five categories including the top honour which was awarded to Arrernte man, William Tilmouth.

title.children: Stolen Generations survivor wins national human rights award

image.altText: A woman pushes Natasha Fyles with one hand and pushes a paper plate into her face with the other hand

props.synopsis: A former Darwin real estate agent charged with assaulting the Northern Territory's then-chief minister with a plate of crepes has tried to justify her actions as a "protest" against COVID-19 rules.

title.children: Alleged crepe assault on ex-NT leader left her 'visibly distressed', court hears

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: Country music star Lee Kernaghan, powerful business person Mick Burns, traditional owner Brian Tipungwuti and media heavyweight Nick Fordham all provided character references for celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright ahead of his sentencing, court documents show.

title.children: The high-profile people who wrote character references for Matt Wright

image.altText: A young Indigenous man crouching on sandy beach, holding green fishing line ring holder, black t-shirt, camo shorts.

props.synopsis: This remote East Arnhem land community is home to 50 permanent residents. There's no shop and only one road in or out. And its unconventional approach to teaching is keeping kids in the classroom.

title.children: Teaching on country in remote East Arnhem Land

image.altText: A man with a white beard and balding head smiles next to a woman with shoulder-length brown hair who is also smiling

props.synopsis: Nick Reiner is being held in custody in the US according to the Los Angeles Sheriff's Department.

title.children: Son arrested on suspicion of murder after Rob Reiner and wife found dead

image.altText: Donald Trump welcomes Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy

props.synopsis: Marathon talks between the US and Ukraine could see NATO-like security guarantees extended to Kyiv under a peace deal.

title.children: Ukraine says 'real progress' made in marathon peace talks

image.altText: crash scene on rural road

props.synopsis: Four adult passengers in a van, who are yet to be formally identified, died at the scene, north of Shepparton in Victoria. Five injured people, including three children and the male driver, were taken to various hospitals.

title.children: Four killed in Victorian crash may have been farm workers, police say

image.altText: Multiple FBI officers walk around outside a home during the day as snow blankets the lawn

props.synopsis: With police releasing a person of interest, the manhunt continues for the Brown University shooter who killed two students and injured nine others.

title.children: Manhunt renewed after police release Brown University shooting suspect

image.altText: A snowman made of sand is seen on Christmas Day at Bondi Beach in Sydney

props.synopsis: With only nine more sleeps until Christmas, we have now entered the meteorological window of predictability — in other words, forecasts are more accurate than just guessing the weather.

title.children: Capital city weather forecasts across Australia for Christmas Day

image.altText: Stocks displayed on a screen at the ASX

props.synopsis: The ASX has slipped into the red after a positive start to the session. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX wilts as sentiment turns against miners and banks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX slips 0.3% as sentiment shifts, miners fall
Ford retreats from EVs, takes $30 billion charge as Trump policies grip industry
ASX up 0.3% lifted by banks and miners

image.altText: GettyImages-966334616

props.synopsis: A NSW cricketer, who has played at Sheffield Shield level, is banned from playing after allegations he sent nude photos to young teammates.

title.children: Cricketer banned after allegations he sent nude photos to teammates

image.altText: The LA skyline is seen in front of mountains.

props.synopsis: US authorities say a New Year's Eve terror plot to bomb five sites in California and attack immigration agents has been thwarted.

title.children: Terrorists were planning New Year's Eve bombings in LA, US authorities say

image.altText: A flood camera showing water on the road at Subway Creek in the Noosa region on Tuesday morning.

props.synopsis: Storms and heavy rain are forecast to again hit large parts of Queensland today, with temperatures dropping across much of the sunshine state.

title.children: Noosa hit with flash flooding after 180mm of rain falls overnight

image.altText: Pat Cummins bowls in the nets.

props.synopsis: The third Ashes Test is upon us and the series is on the line. Here's everything you need to know about the clash in Adelaide.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval

image.altText: A man poses with his fist

props.synopsis: Kwang Kyung Yoo murdered a woman and child at a Sydney taekwondo studio before killing the woman's husband at their home.

title.children: Former taekwondo instructor jailed for 'senseless' murders of three people

image.altText: Rachael Carpani, a young woman with blonde hair walking down a street.

props.synopsis: Rachael Carpani had recently appeared on long-running Australian soap Home and Away and frequently spoke out on a range of issues, including the need to address domestic violence.

title.children: McLeod's Daughters star Rachael Carpani dies aged 45

image.altText: monopoly board set up for a game

props.synopsis: Over the holiday period, the right game can make all the difference while spending time with friends and family.

title.children: Put away the Monopoly board: Best games to play and gift this summer

image.altText: Samantha Hind lies in bed in a hospital wearing a neck brace.

props.synopsis: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

title.children: Woman run over by car while sunbaking reunites with paramedics who saved her

image.altText: A white woman with white and brown hair sits on a couch looking directly at the camera wearing a green jumper.

props.synopsis: Victims say NSW Police's frontline officers are still catching up with the changed legislation, which makes non-payment for sexual services a criminal offence.

title.children: How NSW's consent laws now protect sex workers against fraudulent clients

image.altText: An image of a bushfire at nighttime burning amongst tall trees. A firetruck is off to the side.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's emergency warning system fails as multiple bushfires threaten lives and homes in the state's south, but emergency warnings for the blazes are downgraded.

title.children: Multiple emergency bushfires downgraded across WA after website crashes

image.altText: A young wombat on a couch, with a cushion in the background, approaches the camera.

props.synopsis: The ACT government is considering how to better manage the territory's wombat population, in response to challenges being experienced by farmers.

title.children: Advocates concerned over wombat management plan

image.altText: A fire in a unit complex in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: A crime scene has been declared, with emergency services saying one man was taken to hospital in a life-threatening condition after sustaining "significant burns".

title.children: Crime scene declared, three taken to hospital after Brisbane unit fire

image.altText: A man and three women, all smiling.

props.synopsis: New laws to protect people from targeted violence have sailed through Tasmania's parliament, with experts celebrating their "innovative" approach. But some say the job is not done yet, with work still needed to implement them successfully.

title.children: 'Everyone is protected': Tasmania's new hate crime laws praised as nation-leading

image.altText: A white car, behind a police tape, a blue tent is set up behind.

props.synopsis: Barkindji mother-of-two Sonya Dutton, 31, was found in her family's Wilcannia residence on March 29, 2022 — four days after she was reportedly last seen.

title.children: 'Unanswered questions' despite inquest into mum found dead in backyard

image.altText: GettyImages-2251436501

props.synopsis: Richmond takes Olivia Wolmarans with the top pick in the AFLW draft, as the Suns complete a stunning raid.

title.children: Suns complete stunning AFLW draft raid as Tigers take power forward

image.altText: Four golden mushrooms growing in the grass of a cattle paddock.

props.synopsis: A farmer is concerned for the safety of people foraging for magic mushrooms, which he has sprayed with herbicide, as a toxicologist warns about the dangers of fungi.

title.children: Nimbin farmer warns magic mushrooms sprayed with poison

image.altText: GettyImages-2252042046

props.synopsis: A Scottish darts player has apologised to fans after he punched a table during a loss at the world championship.

title.children: Darts player left bloodied after punching table following loss

image.altText: A man looking serious with his expression reflected in the water of an aquaculture tank that he is leaning on.

props.synopsis: Mary River cod were fished to the brink of extinction, their habitat destroyed, even blasted with gelignite, but a recovery plan is being updated.

title.children: Gelignite blasts, overfishing, habitat destruction decimated Mary River cod numbers

image.altText: Headshot selfie of a woung woman wearing glasses

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old man admits killing Perth lawyer Alice McShera, whose body was found in a hotel room in the upmarket Crown Towers complex in 2023.

title.children: Courtroom packed as man admits murdering Perth lawyer at upmarket hotel

image.altText: a newsagency shop front with crack in top wall and advertising along facade

props.synopsis: Twenty-five London plane trees are set to be removed from Hamilton after they were found to be causing problems with local infrastructure.

title.children: London plane trees to be cut down in main street of Victorian city
